claim_text: Mirror Cone Tomographic Volumetric Additive Manufacturing is a form of tomographic/volumetric 3D printing where many 2D projections delivered over angle accumulate light dose inside a photopolymer so that only the intended 3D shape reaches the cure threshold (computed-axial-lithography style).

resolution.criteria: Find a primary-source description of CAL/TVAM establishing the dose-accumulation-from-projections principle as the basis of volumetric additive manufacturing.
